Monrovia, CA 29/2/2012 Just tried my first Fatburger and I have to say I'm a fan. Started with the 1/2 lb middle of the spectrum choice, gotta work up to the 1-1/2 pounder. It was really good, the bacon was very smokey and they offer swiss cheese as a choice not just american. The big plus for me is that it was made to order from a ball of beef that was fresh not frozen.They also have A1 which I love. Gotta try the fat fries next time the skinny were just OK.
The only criticism I have is that it could have been juicier, but in this day and age nobody is cooking their burgers medium anymore.

Pasadena, CA 5/7/2012 Usually I'm a fan of fatburger, but this one really altered my opinion.
I had the WORST experience at this location just the other day. Not sure I'll be going to any other locations very often based on this latest experience.
First of all... They did not serve several of the items that were on the menu. That really just confuses your customers in the first place, at least take it off the menu to show us what's actually available. I asked her if i could get an order of chili fries without the cheese since my mom is lactose-intolerant. She asked another employee if they could even "do that". And the other employee wasn't even sure if that was possible. When she repeated our order back, she messed it up multiple times and we corrected her.... Surprisingly we got the right order
Then as we paid, we used a LivingSocial coupon for $16, but they said they don't accept them anymore since they are under new management. The people behind us used the same exact coupon and were also denied. But in my personal opinion, they should not have offered the deal on LivingSocial anyway. We felt ripped off and blown off.
While ordering, the employees were just rude and not considerate of the customer's experience at all. They did not welcome us or even smile. They just asked what we wanted to order. Also they just had a bad additude that showed that they obviously did not want to be there. No Hellos, Thanks Yous or Welcomes, though they would barely have changed my experience...
The quality of the food was not worth all of the trouble or the time that we had all wasted just from ordering the food. Burger was pretty dry overall, including both the patty and the bun. It literally left my mouth dry. The fries were definitely undercooked, leaving that raw flavor in my mouth while eating their chili fries, which barely had any chili on it.
The few minor pluses: its cheap and you have open options to add items to your burger, but there are other burger joints in pasadena or anywhere that you can find with new and better additions to your burger (i.e. Jake's, the Counter, etc.)

Pasadena, CA 24/1/2012 What is there not to love about a burger place with the word "FAT" in the name? Nothing!!! But, just an FYI...Fatburger should really be renamed "FAT and SLOW Burger." Now don't get me wrong, I love the food here and the staff is really nice. You just need to know going in that this is not FAST, fast food...it is SLOW fast food. Each burger is made to order so it takes a little longer, but it is worth it. Your fries will be hot when you get them and the shakes are made with hand-dipped ice cream. Consider this a public service announcement...it will take 15-20 minutes for you to get your food so plan accordingly.
The burgers are giant, yummy, greasy, fatty, unctuous piles of deliciousness! The chili cheese skinny fries are a delectable oxymoron. The shakes are made with real ice cream and are the perfect consistency. The ingredients are all very fresh. The staff is really awesome...so please do not yell at them because your food WILL take too long. Just sit back and enjoy the TV, interesting acoustics, and view of Lake Avenue in this former Taco Bell space. As soon as your burger arrives you will know it was worth the wait.

Arcadia, CA 22/2/2012 5 photos Food/Cost: (2/5) I got the Medium Deal ($8.69; $1 extra for Onion Rings) which is basically a burger combo with medium fries and a drink. The Fat Fries here were awesome -- truly fat, meaty (in the potato sense) and piping hot. Plus, they give an exorbitant portion of fries, probably 2 XL potatoes worth. I also had some of my brother's Onion Rings, which weren't the type I liked (I like them fat, crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside), though perhaps some may like it -- they were extremely crunchy, but in a thin, dry way through and through. The portion of the Rings weren't as impressive as the fries; I counted 10 rings. And the burger? Not impressive to me -- the relatively thick patty was very chewy and sinewy. All in all, I've had better.
Ambiance: (3/5) There was only 4 people inside at 7:00pm when I came today, a Tuesday. The place is pretty small; I'd say about eight 2-person tables and 6-8 booth seats. You get those shiny, old-school red plastic covered diner chairs which are kinda cute, but otherwise the place is slightly rundown.
Location: (3/5) This Fatburger is found just a tad north of the 210Fwy, on Lake Avenue. The area is not great, but its okay. There's a private lot in the back so parking isn't really an issue.
Service: (2.5/5) Like the other reviews have mentioned, the service isn't at the typical "fast" food speed. I sat in the drive thru for 12 minutes while they made my order. Good thing I was the only one in the drive thru; if there were even just 2 cars before me I would have had to wait for half an hour?! Speed aside, the staff here was pretty nice.
Overall: (2.5/5) Neh. I tried Fatburger because one of my friends had really good things to say about it. It was just okay; for the same money you can get better burgers elsewhere, perhaps at the plethora of mom-n-pop burger joints around.

The gentleman on the other side of the receiver informed me that they unfortunately close the dining room at 10pm but close the drive thru at 11pm. Pasadena, CA 8/11/2010 1 Check-in Here Sorry Fat Burger.....I was really rooting for you guys but you really disappointed me last night. I didn't even finish ordering before I was writing this bad review in my head.
First of all, the drive thru line was pretty gnarly. I'd say that it rivals an In N Out drive thru line any day, and we've all felt like we wasted our lives in one of THOSE lines before. But a long line usually means there's a demand, so I was reassured to notice the impressive crowd jones-ing' for their Fat-fix. I half expected there to be some wait time at 8pm on a Sunday night anyway, and I sure as hell wasn't going to get out of my car at night, on Lake, North of the 210 for fear of getting gang raped. (Ok, the neighborhood isn't THAT bad, but I've been watching a lot of Law and Order SVU lately......it leaves any short white girl shaking in her Ugg boots when she ventures away from her home for a hot meal) They had an attendant take orders before you could see the "big board", which is really nerve-wrecking if you're a Fat Burger virgin (far from it on my end, but it's been a few years since I've ordered here), The attendant did have to-go menus for review on hand, but then you had to turn on your harsh, unflattering overhead light in your car and make quick, possibly rash decisions while he waits, tapping his stylus impatiently. I forgot to order my burger with swiss cheese, and I blame the hovering burger monger.
Second of all, who runs out of bacon? I understand if it's a side item that you don't need to keep stocked because no one orders it, but when you make it the star of your menu you need to prepare. I was already waiting 10 minutes in line by the time they took my order, and unless I wanted to 4-wheel it over the concrete divider, I was stuck in the drive thru line and had to make due with a lack luster order. The loss of bacon also meant that I couldn't order the wedge salad that I was counting on, and probably would have earned Fat Burger another 2 stars if it was available.
The burger itself was enjoyable enough -the meat had a nice seasoned taste, bun was soft, and the toppings were plentiful. I'm a huge pickle fan, and the use of sweet relish almost threw me, but I quickly accepted the new combination of flavors. I like the option of the skinny fries and the fat fries -the fat fries are Red Robin-esque, minus the seasoning.....but luckily I have a container of the Red Robin seasoning at home. My strawberry milkshake was too thick, and undrinkable until it melted down enough to move up the straw. I'm sending Fat Burger my Botox bill when I'm in my 40's. But I did like the option of getting whipped cream on my milkshake. Fat Burger is all about options -reg, turkey, chicken or veggie burger. Fat or skinny fries. Cheese, bacon, chili or fried egg topping. Chocolate, vanilla or strawberry shake. I like options......until they give me an option and rip the rug from under me when they run out of said option.
Let's talk location, location, location. The location is a pain in the ass to get to if you're coming from the south on Lake; lots of turning around. The parking lot does accommodate for the long drive thru lane, so cars are not backing up traffic on Lake. I know it's their trademark, but this building is such a neighborhood eyesore! Even for a semi-ghetto area, who wants get their eyes raped by a neon yellow brick building with a flaming red roof on their commute every day?! You have to turn right out of the drive thru, so if u thought u had it easy coming in from the north, you're in the same inconvenient boat us South Lake'rs were when we drove in. Welcome to our boat North Lake'rs!
Fat Burger, you almost had me with the fries, and the tasty burger, but here's where you screwed your chances of getting a good review from this Yelper: I took one look at those plain, unseasoned fries and decided to ask for some blue cheese dipping sauce before I sped off.... *deep breath* ....hold on, give me a second, I'm still pretty upset about this. The drive thru guy told me they didn't have any blue cheese dressing. I gawked at him and asked, "Uhhh, I don't understand, how do you make a wedge salad without blue cheese dressing?" His TKO reply? "We make it with ranch." I'd give anything to have some water in my mouth at that moment so I could do a spit-take to express my pure shock. If I found out that they served me "The Wedge" salad with ranch dressing, I would have driven back there, got out of my car (my rage would have out-weighed my fear of rape), knee'd all of the employees in the groin and dumped their imitation salad over their heads. In this fantasy everyone in the restaurant would stand and applaud my actions, I'd do a slow motion hair toss, and walk "hip-action style" back to my car.
